thread.section_title: Yahoo! Finance: Property Management Industry News
thread.title: Zillow (Z) Stock Gains Following Earnings Beat
thread.title_full: Zillow (Z) Stock Gains Following Earnings Beat

title: Zillow (Z) Stock Gains Following Earnings Beat
text:
Reprint 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) -- Zillow ( Z - Get Report ) shares are up 5.1% to $77.99 in early market trading on Wednesday after the company beat analysts second quarter expectations yesterday. 
The Internet real estate marketplace reported a second quarter net loss of 1 cent per share on revenue that increased 117.7% year over year to $171.27 million. 
Analysts' on average were expecting the company to report a loss of 26 cents per share on revenue of $168.69. 
Zillow has a 72% marketshare of mobile exclusive visitors to the real estate category, according to comScore, and reported 141 million average monthly users across all its platforms in the quarter. 
"Zillow Group had a strong second quarter, beating our own expectations for revenue and EBITDA," CEO Spencer Rascoff said in a statement. "We've been very focused operationally on the integration of Trulia, and made great progress on a number of fronts." 
TheStreet Ratings team rates ZILLOW GROUP INC as a Hold with a ratings score of C-. TheStreet Ratings Team has this to say about their recommendation: 
"We rate ZILLOW GROUP INC (Z) a HOLD. The primary factors that have impacted our rating are mixed ? some indicating strength, some showing weaknesses, with little evidence to justify the expectation of either a positive or negative performance for this stock relative to most other stocks. The company's strengths can be seen in multiple areas, such as its robust revenue growth, largely solid financial position with reasonable debt levels by most measures and expanding profit margins. However, as a counter to these strengths, we also find weaknesses including deteriorating net income, disappointing return on equity and weak operating cash flow."
